info.powah.gen.mode:
The reactor will stop when is full and start 
when has less than 70% of energy.
wiki.powah.player_aerial_pearl: Use an Aerial Pearl on Zombie or Husk.
wiki.powah.binding_card_dim: Use a Binding card on Enderman or Endermite.
wiki.powah.lens_of_ender: Use a Photoelectric Pane on Enderman or Endermite.
chat.powah.not.enough.blocks: Not enough Blocks! you need %s more!
chat.powah.no.binding: This Card is already bound to %s!
book.powah.text.energizing:
Used to energize items, require at least one Energizing Rods in range of %s to work, the energizing speed depends on amount of rods and the rod tier (I/O rate).
The orb does not require energy but the rods must be placed on cables or any Forge Energy (FE) block to work.
book.powah.text.energizing_2: When placing the orb/rod in range will automatically link to each other, also you can use the Wrench with Link mode to re-link them.
book.powah.text.energizing_orb: Energizing Orb does not require energy.
book.powah.text.furnators: Generates FE by consuming Furnace fuel like coal, wood ..., high tiers just burn fuel faster.
book.powah.text.magmators: Generates FE energy by consuming high temp fluids like Lava, high tiers just burn fuel faster.
book.powah.text.thermo_generators: Generates FE energy when placed on top of a high temp block/fluid like lava, require a coolant fluid like water to run.
book.powah.text.solar_panels: Generates energy (FE) when exposed to sunlight, high tiers generates more FE/t, any block that stop light above the Solar panel will stop its production.
book.powah.text.reactors:
A multi-block (FE) generator use Uraninite as main fuel.
To build it you will need 36 Reactor block in your hand and placing them in a 4X3 replaceable area, then the reactor will complete building itself automatically.
book.powah.text.reactors_cooling: When Generating energy the reactor heats up causing it to consume fuel faster and generating less FE/t, so you need to cool it down using a coolant like water, also you can use a solid coolant like snow or ice for extra coldness, solid coolant require liquid coolant to work.
book.powah.text.reactors_m:
Keep the reactor buffer full of fuel for better production.
Carbon materials like coal, wood..., will improve the fuel efficiency and will add +180 C of heat.
Redstone will speed up the production and the fuel consumption and will add +120 C of heat.
book.powah.text.reactors_redstone: It is possible to turn the reactor on and off with a redstone signal going into one of the I/O ports. (It has to be a straight line into the block.) Adjust the Redstone setting in the reactor GUI
book.powah.text.energy_cells:
Used to store energy (FE), input an output energy from 6 configurable sides, high tiers store more energy and has a better energy transfer rate, each Energy Cell can charge up to 2 chargeable items.
Energy cells can Also be used to upgrade the capacity of a Ender Network channel by Shift clicking an Energy Cell to an Ender Cell GUI, if the Energy Cell contain energy then will also be applied to the ender network channel.
book.powah.text.ender_cells:
Used to store energy (FE) to the ender network of the owner.
You can access the energy stored from anywhere in the world by selecting an active channel you want to use from the GUI, the channel start with 0 FE of capacity so you need to add capacity to it by shift clicking an Energy Cell or Battery to the Ender Cell GUI, the capacity/energy added is same of the Energy Cell or Battery you've added (Shift clicked), Max capacity a channel can have is 2 billion.
The Ender Cell that you want to transfer power from/to should have an active channel with a valid capacity.
book.powah.text.cables: Used to transfer power between machines.
book.powah.text.ender_gates:
Transfer energy between the adjacent block and the ender network.
Unlike the Ender cell you can not Upgrade the network from it
book.powah.text.discharger: Used to drain energy (FE) out of charged items and then store it to an internal buffer if then connected via cables to extract that stored power and re-using it again.
book.powah.text.energy_hopper: Charge chargeable items inside an adjacent inventory like a chest or any block with an accessible inventory and not a not has forge energy.
book.powah.text.player_transmitters: Charge items in linked player inventory including armor slots and off hand anywhere in the same dimension for the basic one and across dimension for the dimensional, both transmitters require a Binding Card to link, the dimensional transmitter can hold up to 2 Binding cards.
book.powah.text.wrench:
The Wrench has 3 modes:
Config Mode: used to change cables I/O configuration.
Link Mode: used to link linkable blocks like energizing orb and rods.
Rotate Mode: used to rotate blocks horizontally.
book.powah.text.battery: Charge items when is in player inventory, can Also be used to upgrade the capacity of a Ender Network channel by Shift clicking a Battery to an Ender Cell GUI, if the Battery contain energy then will also be applied to the ender network channel.
book.powah.text.player_aerial_pearl:
Used for crafting some kind of witlessly player linked items.
To get it use an Aerial Pearl on a Zombie or Husk.
book.powah.text.binding_card: Used to link player with certain block in the same dimension eg: Player Transmitter, Right click to bind.
book.powah.text.binding_card_dim: Used to link player with certain block across dimension eg: Player Transmitter, Right click to bind.
book.powah.text.lens_of_ender: When Applied to a Solar Panel will make it see through blocks.
